attributes.action: Legislate to require positive opting-in before marketing organisations are authorised to use personal data
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Many companies' forms and surveys provide an easily-overlooked tiny box hidden in the small print that has to be checked if you don't want your personal data passed on to marketing organisations.  If this is neglected,  an endless series of irritating further contacts is to be expected.

Approval to disseminate personal data should never depend on extreme vigilance, and the default position should be that you are deemed to have opted out of any further use of the information you have provided unless you positively opt in.  The government should legislate to make this the case, and make the current practice illegal.
